title: Data Governance Analyst
description: This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.<p><br></p>At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.<p><br></p>Data Governance Analyst<p><br></p>Role Description<p><br></p>This role will be responsible for working with the data governance and data quality teams at AXIS to support the data governance objectives of the organization, including but not limited to defining requirements, managing projects, and coordinating with the business, IT, operations, and other departments to discuss, develop, and implement data solutions that ensure alignment with data governance standards and policies. The role may work with the IT department to set data requirements and ensure consistent presentation, consistent definition, accuracy, and accessibility of data throughout the data lifecycle.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prototype, develop, maintain various data acquisition and retrieval flows. Requiring having an in-depth understanding of data systems, and how they relate to use of data by actuaries, finance, and other business users.</li><li> Work with the business and source data experts to ensure data is accurate and fit for purpose, consistently defined and consistently presented; develop and implement control processes as necessary to monitor data accuracy and quality.</li><li> Manage data governance projects related to data dictionaries, reference data management, data lineage, aligned with business priorities.</li><li> Work hands on as necessary to develop prototypes of solutions to validate the requirements and designs. Provide data-related requirements to segment IT and assist with UAT as needed to implement solutions in production environments.</li><li> Work closely with IT, Finance, and Operations to execute a change process that includes all data creators, managers, and users to ensure that data and analytical solutions meet needs across the Insurance and Reinsurance areas. Work with business intelligence resources to ensure that these solutions will also meet requirements for management information / business intelligence needs. Solutions need to balance both ad-hoc needs as well as longer term strategic development.</li><li> Utilize advanced excel functions, VBA, etc. to build solutions to data related issues. Including pulling and inserting data from SQL Server, building reports, etc.</li><li> Work with IT to ensure that data elements, logic, etc. aligns with the needs and expectations of the organization.</li><li> Assist in implementing data governance tools.</li><li> Communicate openly and often with other members of the Data &amp; Analytics team.<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills And Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience</li><li> Prior experience delivering, managing, and defining data for analytics and business intelligence solutions</li><li> Experience in project management.</li><li> Experience with insurance concepts/terminology</li><li> Experience in / with:</li><li>SQL/T-SQL - SQL Server Management Studio, Access</li><li>VBA</li><li>Excel</li><li>Word</li><li>PowerPoint</li><li>SSIS, not required but experience is a plus</li><li>SharePoint, not required but experience is a plus<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Salary Range:<p><br></p>For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $60K to $75K. The specific salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including the experience of the successful candidate and their work location.<p><br></p>In addition, all employees are eligible for competitive incentive targets, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for employees and their families, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.

description: Thank you for your interest in our exciting Data Scientist opportunity! This remote position is perfect for those who are looking to grow their skills while working on diverse and challenging projects.<br><br>As a Data Scientist with our Practice, you will have the opportunity to work directly with clients to identify business problems, explore data, and develop effective solutions using advanced analytics techniques. Knowledge of relational databases such as SQL/MySQL is also required, as well as the ability to integrate data from various sources into an efficient and intuitive database structure. A Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics, business administration, or a related field is preferred.<br><br>In addition to the required qualifications, we are looking for a team player who has excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. You should be focused on delivering results and have a strong work ethic based on a desire to exceed expectations. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are also a must, as you will be working with clients from various industries.<br><br>At our company, we value innovation and continuous improvement. We encourage our employees to remain flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. If you're passionate about data science and are looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply today!<br><br>Employment Type: Contractor<br><br>Salary: $ 122,000.00 Per Year

title: Applications Engineer
description: The Asahi Kasei Group operates with a commitment of creating for tomorrow. Our business sectors, Material, Homes, and Health Care, contribute to the development of society by anticipating the changing needs of those around the world. We look for candidates that offer a fresh perspective and a variety of skills to help us achieve our commitment.<p><br></p>We are currently seeking applications to fill the following job opening at Asahi Kasei Bioprocess where we sell Planova® virus removal filters and develops and manufactures related bioprocess equipment.<p><br></p><strong>Company:</strong><p><br></p>Asahi Kasei Bioprocess America, Inc.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Asahi Kasei Bioprocess America, Inc. (AKBA) provides pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical manufacturers with a comprehensive suite of tools to maximize safety and improve yields of biotherapeutics during research, clinical and commercial-scale production. Planova™ virus-removal filters anchor a diverse product portfolio defined by quality, consistency, and scalability. Additional areas of expertise include liquid chromatography, inline buffer dilution and oligonucleotide synthesis.<p><br></p>We are a growing team (140+) of professionals excited about what we do and our ability to impact healthcare delivery systems worldwide. We offer a "big company" benefits package and a "small company" culture and work environment. Every employee at Asahi Kasei Bioprocess can impact our future.<p><br></p>As an Asahi Kasei Bioprocess America employee, you will enjoy:<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong company culture</li><li>Competitive Compensation with Bonuses</li><li>Great health benefits with the company paying over 80% of insurance premiums</li><li>Wellness Program</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>Strong company match to 401(k) contributions</li><li>Tuition reimbursement program</li><li>Giving Program</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p><br></p>We are currently looking for an <strong>Applications Engineer</strong> to join our team at Asahi Kasei Bioprocess! The person in this role will serve as the primary lead for evaluating client technical application/process needs and making recommendations for product configurations and designs. This role will interface directly with clients and the company’s Fluid Management Business Unit account managers in US, Europe and Asia. Engage with customer’s engineers to understand technical specifications, recommend solutions, and provide process support for the successful implementation of client systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Technical Bid Package Review and Applications Support:<p><br></p><ul><li>Review bid package specifications such as piping, electrical, controls, materials, process and user requirement specifications. Determine feasibility to comply and provide suggestions for optimized solutions.</li><li>Confer with customers and engineers to assess equipment needs and to determine system configuration and performance requirements.</li><li>Perform sizing calculations to verify appropriate component or configuration selection.</li><li>Liaise with component suppliers to stay up to date on emerging technologies and trends as they relate to customer processes.</li><li>Develop and maintain relationship with clients, internal project engineers, project managers, outside account managers, and key suppliers.</li><li>For orders that are won, assist the handoff of the bid package to the internal project engineer during the project kickoff.</li><li>Consult with customer to clarify ambiguous or conflicting technical specifications in the bid package.</li></ul><p><br></p>Process Support:<p><br></p><ul><li>Provide onsite and/or remote technical support and troubleshooting for clients.</li><li>Conduct internal and external training sessions across process types and system operations.</li><li>Assist commissioning and testing activities, as required, to ensure smooth integration into customer site and operations.</li><li>Perform live demos and product trials that model client processes.</li></ul><p><br></p>Sales Support and New Product Development:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work as in-house SME to assist customers with defining specifications, navigating system options, and selecting the correct components.</li><li>Support and give technical presentations of company’s engineered systems and capabilities to customers with outside account managers.</li><li>Work with Sr. Development and Automation Engineers on form, fit, function decisions and new software feature development.</li><li>Based on knowledge gained in discussions with end users, advise senior leaders on new product development improvement areas and priorities.</li><li>Assist creation of application notes and technical notes to showcase product features and functionality.</li></ul><p><br></p>Additional Duties/Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Occasional booth duties at trade shows (2-4 per year) for meeting customers, networking with suppliers and keeping up to date on industry trends.</li><li>Refine and improve handoffs between Sales and Operations team to drive efficiency</li><li>Special projects as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications/Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a project engineering role or comparable inside sales engineering role, and knowledge of project management principles.</li><li>Experience in bioprocess liquid handling equipment and processes, such as oligonucleotide synthesis, chromatography, and filtration systems preferred.</li><li>Experience in buffer formulation and preparation preferred.</li><li>Chemical, Biomedical, Mechanical, or other applicable engineering degree required.</li><li>MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) experience at master level.</li><li>Strong customer relations proficiency.</li><li>Understanding of technical and legal implications of RFQs, Quotes, Exceptions and T&amp;Cs.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication aptitude towards a global and multi-cultural customer base.</li><li>Must be highly detail oriented and able to convey a professional brand image.</li><li>Strong teamwork and time management skills.</li><li>Experience using ERP systems is preferred (company uses MS-NAV).</li><li>Experience using CRM systems is preferred (company uses Salesforce).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands/Environmental Conditions:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Travel: 6-8 domestic or international trips per year, as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>As an equal opportunity employer, Asahi Kasei believes a diverse workforce will provide us with the ability to continuously support the changes in the economy, society, and environment.</em><p><br></p>

description: <strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>Program all CNC Lathes and CNC Machine Centers to form precision metal parts and components utilizing appropriate shop equipment (CNC mills, lathes, grinders, etc.) in a timely and efficient manner with minimal supervision. Plans numerical control program to control contour path machining of metal parts on automatic machine tools.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Uses G-Code and/or software program such as Mastercam to program CNC machines.</li><li> Analyzes drawings, sketches, and design data of part to determine dimension and configuration of cuts, plan sequence of operations, selection/mfg. of cutting tools, fixtures and machine speeds and feed rates to assure efficient use of tools and time.</li><li> Installs collets, bushings, and bar pullers in stock-feeding mechanism, using wrenches and screwdrivers.</li><li> Positions and secures tools in tool holders, verifying positions with gauges and other measuring instruments.</li><li> Computes angular and linear dimensions, radii, and curvatures, and outlines sequence of operations required to machine part.</li><li> Writes instruction sheets and cutter lists to guide setup and operation of machine.</li><li> Writes program of machine instructions in symbolic language to encode direct numerical control database to regulate movement of machine along cutting path.</li><li> Revises program to eliminate instruction errors or omissions, if necessary.</li><li> Observes operation of machine on trial run to prove programmed instructions.</li><li> Perform mechanical tasks including loading and unloading vices, fixtures and parts.</li><li> Establish and set appropriate tool offsets.</li><li> Loads material, starts machine, observes operation, and verifies conformance to specifications of first-run, sample work pieces and in-process parts, using such instruments as fixed gauges, calipers and micrometers.</li><li> Runs machine through cycle, stopping machine and adjusting tool positions and machine controls to allow for such factors as timing, clearance between moving parts, and chip removal.</li><li> Maintain statistical process control charts by reading and recording measurements when required.</li><li> Visually inspect production for burrs, scrapes, rust and other defects.</li><li> Replace worn tools.</li><li> Operates bench grinder or cutter-grinding machine to sharpen tools.</li><li> Sets up machines for other workers; instructs workers and provide information as needed.</li><li> Responsible for maintenance of machine, including but not limited to lubrication and adjustment and repairs of equipment per manufacturer's manual.</li><li> Update data collection system at beginning and end of each task using barcode scanning and basic data entry.</li><li> Maintain organized and clean work area.</li><li> Receive, understand and follow all written and oral instruction.</li><li> Timely completion of all paperwork associated with position including move tags</li><li> Comply with all company policies and procedures including safety and attendance requirements.</li><li> Participate in activities to increase personal skill level, overall departmental processes and product quality.</li><li> Resolve day-to-day issues by working effectively with others and communicating problems with supervisor.</li><li> Maintain meet or exceed rating on all performance evaluations.</li><li> Follow the company safety rules and other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Skills And Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 2 years of trade school, vocational education, work experience, or apprenticeship.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of lathes, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vices, etc.</li><li> Mechanical ability to operate equipment</li><li> Blue print reading skills</li><li> Basic math and English skills for part count, written and verbal work instruction.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Physical Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Stand, walk, push, pull, reach overhead, and bend to the floor.</li><li> Lift, carry and move up to 50 pounds of parts and/or equipment occasionally throughout the workday.</li><li> Ability to use a variety of milling machines, drill presses, and equipment including tumblers, air hose, hoists, wrenches, tool-holders, vises, etc.</li><li> 20/20 vision with or without correction</li><li> Use of hands 100% of the workday</li><li> Ability to work in shop environment, exposure to high noise levels, moving equipment and machinery; exposure to dust, fumes and mist; exposure to chemicals including oils and cutting fluids.</li><li> Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify changes in order to alert department lead.<br></li></ul>We offer a 401k plan with 4% company match, BlueCross BlueShield Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, Health Savings Account (HSA), Life Insurance, Short Term Disability Insurance, Attendance Award Program (can earn up to 2-additional PTO days per year by earning perfect attendance), an air conditioned 108,000 sq. foot facility, a great work environment and other benefits.<br><br>EOE
